body: @blizzz

actually i have kind of the same problem.
except i can display them, but the "display name" is replaced by the uid.
so on the first page everything is alright, but as soon as i scroll down, the first two columns are the same.

could it be a php version problem : "php 5.3.3-7+squeeze15"
i've read in an announcement that php 5.4 was required for "paged ldap"...

regards
our php version is 5.4.4-14 which is the standard version on debian 7 wheezy... :-(
i'm getting the same problem. something curious is that uuid's start to show as name after the "first not ldap user" ocurrence

not in my case...

i had try to delete all entries in oc_ldap_user_mapping mysql table and re-run owncloud... bad idea! now i have also only the 30 first ldap users in this table :-( + the users that can log but are not listed first?

the log output from the ldap backend is only informational, not an error. if paged search is not supported by either php or ldap/ad server it's not gonna be used â€“ as before. i think the problem is in the js. did you try latest stable5? i am sure i saw a report like this before and i think it was fixed by @tanghus .

le 26 mars 2013 ã  13:37, blizzz <notifications@github.com> a ã©crit :
> the log output from the ldap backend is only informational, not an error. if paged search is not supported by either php or ldap/ad server it's not gonna be used â€“ as before. i think the problem is in the js. did you try latest stable5? i am sure i saw a report like this before and i think it was fixed by @tanghus .
> 
owncloud: it's the one which is proposed by owncloud repository: 5.0.
php5: 5.4.4-14 (from debian 7 repository)
ldap: 2.4.11-1+lenny2.1 (from debian 5)

thanks

----
pierre malard
please check whether this fixes it for you https://github.com/owncloud/core/pull/2593
nothing new with oc 5.0.3...
please try with clearing your browser cache.

same thing. and, effectivly, in my mysql datables, i have only the 30 first ldap users plus the ones logs specificly. but, whith the admin web interface, i have just 30 users.
i'll try to re-install oc 5.0.3 "from scratch" today and, if i have time, a new upgrade from 4.0.7.

i've updated today to oc 5.0.4 but still the same problem here. i can't get oc to display more than 41 users (why 41)? maybe the number of rows displayed depends on the screen resolution and i have a rather large screen.

when i try to scroll down the list, there aren't any new users displayed. this worked with some previous release of oc 5 (i think 5.0.0 and 5.0.1), but i believe it stopped working with 5.0.2 and hasn't worked ever since.

in  the log display on the admin page i see:

info user_ldap paged search failed :(

our ldap server is an openldap on apple os x 10.8.3.
fix it?

there is still an odd offset like
```
 {"app":"user_ldap","message":"no paged search for us, cpt., limit 10 offset 33","level":1,"time":1367051677}
```
i will give it another look.

> perhaps their is a cache in server?

there is an ldap cache (defaults to 10min) but the log shows that a seach was attempted, i.e. cache was empty for this request.

> when the problems with the loading of users occured, did you make use of multiple bases?
no, only one ldap base declared in oc params.

so, i have try to delete the ldap configuration and re-create it: same results, same warning message.

but i have a trouble. why does these messages are only displayed on the first connection? even if i log out and log in again, they are not displayed again. it's the same thing if i'm trying with an other brother (opera, firefox, safari, â€¦). it's really like when a cache is active on server (is it the ldap cache ttl effect?).

an other question: were is stored the ldap configuration? i don't find it in mysql db tables.

thanks.

yes, it is a server-side cache, i.e. browser-independent. 

the ldap config is stored in the table oc_appconfig. look for the rows with appid = 'user_ldap'

i tracked it down, that  openldap throws an protocol error. unfortunately, openldap is spare on details. there was a mail to their ml years ago, but without answer [1]. honestly, i still am of the opinion that openldap should be made to work with this. as a workaround you could override the usage of paged results. later more about this.

on the other hand, tests with ad for instance are successful.

there are also some refinements need to do on users page js which is not correct atm.

[1] http://www.openldap.org/lists/openldap-software/200406/msg00030.html
update: isolated tests with openldap indeed show that it works. looks like something is in the way what makes it misbehave, but i am still digging.
thanks

so, i spent too much time on thisâ€¦ the problem is. that openldap has some issues with paged results. especially with non-permanent connections as we have them with php and in peculiar when making use of ajax calls. i tried to work around the edges, but i still got errors from openldap on other searches. so, for instance even switching to session-only paged results also led to protocol errors on simple attribute searches, which are necessary to read the display name, for instance. so, the only solution i found, and which does not make me happy at all, is to switch off paged results for the server connection when errors occur. this is not beautiful if you have many many users, but operable.

could you try whether these changes make it work for you? https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/c108a72736744bbdc61be267436b0d4ac8df9ec3

note: you may try to reopen users page a second time.

note 2: on ldap settings save, paged results will be activated again â€“ until the problem turns up again. this is to not be stuck with it for forever.

i've got the same problem with oc 5. in oc 4, with the same ldap-server, the user-listing worked. 
the changes you proposed in https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/c108a72736744bbdc61be267436b0d4ac8df9ec3 made my oc5 to stop working completely.

edit: i missed one closing bracket of https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/c108a72736744bbdc61be267436b0d4ac8df9ec3 in access.php. now it does not crash, but the behaviour is the same. a list of 30 users is shown, an when scrolling down, one more user seems to be loaded by ajax. this particular user is shown wrongly, as the username is "false" whilst it should be just another lastname.

edit edit: after waiting a while without doing any further changes, it seems to work now. (slow, but at least it works)
@dpfe yes, that was what my first note was hinting at. it is slower, because the paged result feature is disabled, as this causes trouble with openldap.  thanks for testing!

i'm having this very same issue on centos 6, oc5.0.7, openldap 2.4.23-32, php-ldap 5.4.16.  i applied your [c108a72] patch, waiting to see if it takes.  reference to my issue on the oc forums: http://forum.owncloud.org/viewtopic.php?f=23&t=12963
  
edit:  i don't think my version of user_ldap is the same, the c108a72 patch doesn't match up.  was there an update to implement the "don't page" patch?  if so, it isn't working on mine.  i still get the following when trying to scroll down in the users list,

{"app":"php","message":"ldap_control_paged_result_response(): result is: protocol error (2) at \/var\/www\/html\/owncloud\/apps\/user_ldap\/lib\/access.php#694","level":2,"time":1372094894}

regards,
brad
